programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Deadly forests. Haunted houses. Mountains where visitors never return alive. Are there such things as evil places? Places where bad things seem to repeatedly - and inexplicably - happen?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare keeps winning a game with Little Field Mouse, and enjoys it so much he doesnt realise she is frustrated with losing. Big Nutbrown Hare helps him realise that winning is less important than making sure everyone enjoys playing the game. So Little Nutbrown Hare invents a new game that Little Field Mouse and her twin siblings can enjoy playing too.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Days On a hot Summer’s day Big Nutbrown Hare wants the young ones to have some relaxing time by the river. Like most young kids they have trouble staying quiet and still. When they do finally manage some quiet time, they experience the variety of life that the river has to offer, including some rare birds and a family of terrapins.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy and Otus are having fun building a den. Help them decorate it.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When a new nameplate is about to be placed on the statue of Admiral Hornblast, it suddenly disappears. Huckle, Sally and Lowly check out the photos and videos taken at the scene and ultimately determine that the statue slide over the plate when it was bumped by an out of control bulldozer./Pig Will and Pig Won’t are playing spies. However Pig Won’t suddenly finds himself out of the game when his Secret Spy Ring disappears!

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is climbing a pile of mud in his garden and wonders what the words get up to under all that amazing mess! When Messy needs to know he goes to Okido! When he arrives, Felix and Zoe are off to dinner at Mayor Oki’s house with him and his mother. Mayor Oki is lamenting the size of his pumpkins when they get there and he hopes they can help him make the pumpkins big and ripe, as he has promised his mother her favourite meal – pumpkin soup.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world Messy has just finished eating all the hiking-sock-flavoured jam, and he doesn’t know what to do with all the jars, so he goes to Okido to ask! When Messy lands, Felix and Zoe are playing some new instruments that they made them themselves! Suddenly, Zoe realises she has lost her communicator. Zoe thinks it must be in the Cloudship, so they hail the Okidoodle to take them there. Zam is putting out the rubbish when they arrive, and Zim has just finished cleaning the entire kitchen! Clearly it’s not where Zoe left it, so they check the bins in case it was thrown away by accident. But the rubbish has already been taken when they get there!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Blueberry invites Huck to return to Berry Bitty City to co-write a story with her to submit to an online mystery magazine. He is hopeful that if the story is accepted, he can raise funds for his new Huck’s Hotel for Homeless Pets. But as they write the story, Huck feels he isn’t contributing anything—Blueberry’s insistence on duplicating the style of Patti Persimmon dominates their story. Trouble ensues when Blueberry learns Huck is writing a song with Cherry. She thinks he has found a new writing partner he likes better than her.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Charlie is having a sleepover and has invited Harry, however, Charlies Mum says he is only allowed to bring one of the dinos with him.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry goes to Dino-World to learn how to make origami animals.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In Yellowstone National Park, Jayden, while enjoying the sunrise, hears a distressed noise and discovers a baby bison stuck in a ravine but he then slips into the ravine as well. Leo, Katie, and Hero, who are building tipi huts made of twigs in the garden before Hero accidentally destroys them. They receive Jaydens call for help and with the computer, the rangers learn about the bison. Leo, Katie and Hero travel to Yellowstone, where they use PlatypusOne to rescue Jayden and the baby bison but they only manage to get Jayden out before a small herd of bison becomes agitated and damages PlatypusOne. Ranger Rocky, with bison horns appears and calls Ranger Joey who provides insights into bison behavior. Katie suggests a distraction by enticing the hungry bison with prairie grass. With a pile of prairie grass in place and the herd distracted, they successfully rescue the baby bison from the ravine. They then reunite it with the herd and say their goodbyes. Back at the treehouse, Katie finishes a whole village of tipi huts and Hero carefully contributes.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas travels to Australia where he helps his friend Ace overcome his fear of animals so that he can compete in a super stunt rally.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Sonny is trying to prove himself to be a useful engine so that he can stay working on Sodor, but nobody seems to trust him... nobody apart from Diesel, that is! But can Diesel be trusted?

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu has a new mission: helping Toramento to change the lighthouse’s bulb. Soon he discovers that this is not the only problem with the lighthouse. The rotating lamp is also blocked by a seagulls nest. And the seagull doesnt allow anyone to approach its nest. Grisu, being attacked by the animal, spits a flame and burns the bulb. How to replace it? He must find a solution quickly before a boat runs aground on the reefs. Could Fume do the trick? Grisù asks his father for help. Thanks to Stella and Toramento, Fume will overcome his hate of water, thus being able to reach Grisu. Then, he will replace the light bulb by spitting out the biggest flame ever.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Natureza wants to study hawklings about to hatch on top of Mount Dragonberg and for that, she needs to set up a camera in their nest. Grisu accompanies her – as a fellow mountain climber. But hes not quite a seasoned one and has a few comic failures (fortunately he has a safety rope). As they are about to cross a wooden bridge, Fume – whos tagging along – accidently wakes up a grumpy bear. Surprised, Grisu breathes out a flame that burns the bridge, ruining the expedition. But a firefighter never gives up.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Field Mouse finds a sparkly rock and announces that it’s treasure. Little Nutbrown Hare wants a sparkly treasure too, so they set about finding him one that night, by the silvery light of the full moon. Together, they discover that treasure is found in the most unexpected places. When a very ordinary looking rock cracks open to reveal sparkly crystals inside, Little Nutbrown Hare realises that things are not always what they seem.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The Winter snow is softening in the meadow and Big Nutbrown Hare finds some beautiful flowers peeking through the snow, a sure sign that Spring is finally on its way. Little Nutbrown Hare decides he wants to show Big Nutbrown Hare something special too, something he has never seen before. With the help of his friends Little Nutbrown Hares comes up with a very special and unique treat!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Wilson has one hour to use the camera car to take pictures of three faults: one that’s up high, one that’s down low, and one that’s on something moving. Wilson spots a fault on something moving - Koko’s wagon - and wastes most of his time chasing her without ever getting a picture. Time’s up and Wilson thinks he’s failed his badge, as he’s only photographed two faults: a fallen signpost and faulty doors on a chute at the quarry. But Lori points out that not only is the chute is high up, but also its doors move – so that counts as two things and Wilson wins his badge!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Thinking that Margaret is going to move out, the children decide to go into training to become good children as they think their numerous quarrels have provoked Margaret’s decision.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and his crew are building a special area to celebrate local citizens who have improved the life of Spring City. Each recipient will get to see his or her image inside a golden star on a plinth. But Mayor Madison is struggling to decide who exactly will feature in the very first golden star. Various suggestions include Mr. Bentley, who is very keen to be chosen, Tilly and Jenny. But when the Spring City Rockets suggest Betsy, Scoop decides that the honour should go to a machine – and that machine should be him. Scoop shows off in front of Maria hoping he will be chosen. But his reckless behavior results in cutting through an electric cable and causing a massive power cut.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Scoop is fascinated by a heavy storm, but the impressive lightning damages the Fixham Lighthouse. Bob and the team must repair its lamp and replace its main power cable before dark. On the way they pass Curtis at the Marina and learn that the storm also damaged his motor boat, which hes trying to fix. While Lofty helps remove and replace the lamp, Scoop digs up the old power cable from the lighthouse to shore. With the tide coming in and night-time approaching, Bob and Wendy stay at the lighthouse to finish the job. They get the lamp working again, just as a new lightning storm arrives. Fascinated by the lightning, Scoop accidentally pulls out the new cable and cuts the power.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: All the balls at Farmer Patrick Pigs new mini putt are disappearing. After much investigation Huckle and the gang track the missing balls to Patricks record breaking ‘egg laying’ chicken. / When the gold coins Mr Fix It finds on the beach disappear, Huckle, Lowly and Sally set out to find out where they went.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A young California Sea Lion makes a surprise appearance during Leo’s basketball game. Later, a voyage to find the sea lion’s home turns into a daring rescue on the high seas.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers have a brush with a poacher as they try to return an Indian Star Tortoise to its home in the scrub forest.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Gaspard are camping with Grandma and Grandpa when Grandpa tells them about the forest fairies - Simons not convinced that they exist, but Grandpa insists that they do!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 05 Mepe
programme.desc: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They have many adventures, while they make new friends and get knowledge about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest hold a baking contest to celebrate the arrival of summer, but Dr Owl goes overboard with tasting. With the help of Beetle Bodobács, they manage to save the evening with chimney cakes and dancing. The next day, Dr Owl apologizes and improves his mood with a group workout.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a rainy day, Dollys house gets flooded. When the rain stops, Stanley, the stag beetle, repairs the roof. Berry also helps Dolly, who is upset about her soaked drawings. Berry visits Raymond, the copper beetle, who has plenty of bells. He asks for two special bells to cheer Dolly up. At home, he makes coconut balls and later delivers them to Dolly along with the bells, which make her very happy. Later, Berry paints over the stain caused by the rain, and Dolly repaints the pictures with the help of Flutter and Leapy. The bells bring joy to the house.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, catches a cold on a gloomy, rainy day. Doctor Owl examines her and advises her to rest a lot in bed. Her friends visit often to take care of her, and Flutter always asks them to read from her new book. Soon, everyone knows the story, which tells of a ball held in a splendid castle. One day, Balthazar makes Flutter sad by saying that the princess story is just a fairy tale. Flutter turns away, disappointed, and falls asleep. Balthazar meets Doctor Owl, who notices that something is bothering him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Mama Owls chicks are born, and soon they are strong enough for Berry and Dolly to visit them. Doctor Owl asks for their help while he works. The owl babies are very lively, and Berry and Dolly play with them enthusiastically and patiently. At lunchtime, Mama Owl is running out of patience, but eventually, they manage to feed the chicks. After finishing lunch and resting a little, the little ones regain their energy. They happily jump around Mama Owl, who feels it is time that the chicks learn to fly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, plays beautifully on his violin for the forest inhabitants, but one day, no one listens to his new piece. First, he looks for Berry, Balthazar, and Stanley, but they are busy. He goes to Dolly, but she doesn’t have time either. Very discouraged, he decides to leave the forest. However, he meets the Magpie, who welcomes him and cheers him up. Meanwhile, the others begin to search for Alfonso. When they find him, they apologize and invite him to play his new piece at the playground opening.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One autumn day, Reggie Squirrel is visited by his old friend, Otto Badger, who brings a frisbee as a gift. They happily play with it, and when they head home, the frisbee falls at the base of a tree. Later, Berry and his friends find it and play with it, but Balthazar throws it so far that the frisbee vanishes. Reggie Squirrel asks them about it later, but Balthazar denies having seen it. Dolly and Flutter find the frisbee and bring it back to Reggie. Berry, feeling ashamed, admits that they accidentally threw the frisbee and couldnt find it. In the end, they all play happily with it until dark, carefully making sure not to throw it too far.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its Bings turn to choose a game at Ammas crèche so he picks Musical Statues but gets upset when he loses because he chose the game.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Bings mini racing car and the cereal box collide, they make a big mess. Voo Voo the vacuum cleaner does his job well - maybe even too well!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando discover a new climbing frame at the playground. It’s got climbing bits, tippy bits and even a wobbly bridge. But when Bing gets to the top of the slide it’s too scary for him to go down. Bing watches Pando to see how he does it, then he helps Hoppity Voosh to go down. When Hoppity likes it Bing has a go too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Coco and Charlie come to play at Bings house they measure how tall he is, but when they get the measuring ritual wrong, Bing is scared hes growing down!

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: The big neighbourhood race is coming up, and Snaily, who came in last place last year, dreams of winning this time. He discovers his talent on Billys skateboard, but the rules stand in his way.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda is excited about the cake contest, but when she burns her hands, she can’t bake anymore. Her friends at the Guesthouse Appleseed decide to help her by creating a special cake together.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda is excited for her Aunt Emilys visit, but when Emily gets sick, she decides to send her photos. However, her friends make it difficult to take perfect pictures until the costume box provides a funny solution.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Among the newly fallen Autumn leaves Little Nutbrown Hare finds a very peculiar little, hairy, green… ‘something’. Intrigued by what it might be Little Nutbrown Hare asks all his friends, but they all have different answers! It is certainly a very useful ‘something’, great for back scratching and games but it takes Little Grey Squirrel to solve the mystery.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One bright moonlit Autumn night, the Nutbrown Hares are both having trouble sleeping. As they lay quietly in a pile of leaves they listen to the sounds of the night… swish, hoot, wobble, nibble, croak and splash! They go on a journey to discover what’s making the interesting night noises, but will they work out what sound the moon makes?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Chilly Autumn winds blow as Little Nutbrown Hare chases the beautiful fallen leaves. When one wafts so high that only a bird could catch it Little Nutbrown Hare wishes he could fly as well. He and Little Field Mouse try every way they can think of to fly, without luck. They have fun trying, however, and along the way they discover they have their own very special talents.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon, Ferdinand and Gaspard have dressed up as firemen and are playing with the gardening hose in the yard. Being a fireman is a real serious job and our three apprentices still have a lot to learn!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The discovery of a green iguana in the garden leads to an adventure in the rainforest! The Junior Rangers want nothing more than to find the iguana’s home, but a hungry hawk has other plans for the iguana.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn her badge, Koko has to deliver two different types of cargo safely. She goes too fast and nearly breaks her cargo of eggs – then goes too slow, and is nearly late with her cargo of wool. Happily, she realises that different cargos need different delivery methods: slow and steady with the eggs, but faster with the wool. Learning the difference means that she wins her badge!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their badges, the trainees have to play a game. They have to find ‘pairs’ of chuggers behind different-coloured roundhouse doors. Koko and Brewster do well, but easily-distracted Wilson fails the first time around. After a pep talk from Vee, he applies himself – and by concentrating really hard, he wins his badge!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When Nina asks T’choupi to accompany her to the forest for a fitness session, our little hero gets very excited… until they reach the location and there’s no fitness trail in sight! Nina laughs: that’s the funnest part about it - they’ll use the tree trunks, boulders and branches to make their own parcourse! T’choupi drags his heels as he follows Nina through the trail. Then, when he trips and falls, he wants to call it quits… But what if he were to invent his very own fitness trail in the forest? Wouldn’t that be fun…?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: While looking for a lost toy under a bunch of crates, Nina and T’choupi discover some very strange hairs belonging to some unidentified animal … In a mystery, the two friends head off to inspect all the animals of the hamlet in an attempt to track down the owner of the strange fur... But a big surprise awaits them…!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Blindfolded, T’choupi is having the time of his life playing Blind Man’s Bluff with Nina and Luce!... Until he falls over… right in the nettles! Owieee! His parents tend to his little booboo, but he’s not so keen to play all of a sudden - he’s scared he’ll fall in the nettles again! When his parents spur him on, T’choupi gives in and resumes playing. But his motivation has been dampened: now he’s scared of everything!... But wait, T’choupi’s no scaredy-cat, and he’s gonna prove it!!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: The children can hardly contain their excitement because today is the first day of school! Charley, Paulie and Lily have only one thing on their mind: meeting their new teacher! They especially want to know whether she will be nice. But oh, what a disappointment when they find out their teacher is… the school principal and he is very strict. Or isn’t he….?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia has caught mousie pox. Doctor Spotty is sorry but she is not allowed to see Sam anymore for a few days, and get bored alone in her room. How can she play with her friend without disobey?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam has agreed to water Mr. Grumpys flowers. When they enters Mr. Grumpys empty apartment, Sam and Julia discover that Mr. Grumpy has some hidden reasons for being so withdrawn...

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Emily thinks all the other engines are pulling much more exciting loads than she is, so when she is given a huge globe to transport, she decides to show it off.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: One day Bill and Ben tell Timothy he needs to find a truck that is blue and red and yellow and brown. Bill and Ben insist the truck is real, so Timothy sets off to look for it. Bill and Ben think they are very funny, but Timothy has the last laugh when he actually finds some trucks that match their description and brings back smelly rubbish trucks bound for the dump.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and Leo visit the beach and build sand castles, play frisbee, and paddleboard!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou learns what to do when others are being mean.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle and his pals all receive party invitations, but the partys location is a mystery. Small circular marks left behind by whoever delivered the invitations are an important clue. It leads Huckle and pals to Miss Honey whos been walking with a crutch. Grateful for the help she got raking up all her leaves, Miss Honey decided to throw a party for all the volunteers./Huckle and his pals discover a mysterious gigantic spoon.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey and Parrot are rehearsing for a talent show... a synchronized dance number... but of course they are anything but... Mole then appears and tells them of how Swans are known for their graceful couples dance. They decide to go to the lake and learn from the masters. When they arrive they are dazzled by swans dual dance and invite them to play Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: It is nap time at the campsite but monkey cant fall asleep so he is walking back and forth counting his footsteps. Monkey hopes that Bear can help him fall asleep so they venture over to the tundra. There they meet a young Grizzly bear cub who too has problems going to sleep. Bear joins them for a fun game of Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: A Go-Kart Challenge goes topsy-turvy when Peters Go-Kart catches fire and sets ablaze everything in its path!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The Why Files (Norman and Hannah) investigate a mystery involving spilled milk, a half-eaten sausage roll, and strange ‘dog like’ footprints…

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: While practicing for their school’s upcoming Bike Jamboree, Franklin takes a little spill. Spooked, he goes from avoiding his bike altogether to trying to making it tumble-proof. But it is only after finding himself giving Fox advice to keep at a skateboard trick he’s having trouble with that Franklin realizes what he has to do – get back in the saddle! / Goose isn’t having any fun on Franklin’s new holiday – Backwards Day. Franklin has to play to Goose’s strengths to ensure that everyone has a great Backwards Day.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Sitting at the table with her family, Rosie is talking about how she is looking forward to her wonderful holidays with her father. But the little vixen is surprised by the lack of attention of her two brothers, too busy talking about their own holidays. Soon, Rosie feels left out and is worried that the twins might forget her. To prevent this from happening, she becomes very clingy. Singing, making fishing rods, drawing… Rosie is alwaysaround. So much so that it starts to annoy her brothers.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Who has the most extraordinary costume in the savannah? Doodleboo explains to Sketchy how to draw a Zebra

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Who is little but knows how to defend himself? Doodleboo explains how to draw a Crab

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Who is very agile flying through the air? Doodleboo explains to Sketchy how to draw a dragonfly

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave make up their own fairy story in Fairytale Land. They create great characters, like Ruff-Ruff the brave knight, Tweet the fairy princess and Dave the wise panda-wizard. They add some magic, a dragon to chase, a castle and a party, but there are many problems to solve before their ‘happily ever after’ ending!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: A trip to Bouncy Land sparks off a competition between Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave to find out who can bounce the highest. When Hatty’s hat gets stuck up a tree, Ruff-Ruff jumps up to retrieve it, proving he really is the bounciest bouncer.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The snow in the meadow is so deep that Little Nutbrown Hare has to stay under the Old Oak tree. Wondering what he is going to do all day in deep snow and with no one to play with, his imagination soon takes over as he creates new kinds of fun. By the time his friends reach him, Little Nutbrown Hare can’t believe how the time has flown!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a cold but sunny morning in the middle of Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare discovers his friends ice-skating on the frozen pond. He decides to give it a try but slips, slops and slides all over the ice. Will he persevere for long enough to be able to perfect his own unique style, or will he be put off by the natural skill of his friends?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse go on a long trip with Big Nutbrown Hare to find some food he hid away during the warmer months. Little Nutbrown Hare plays with a stick along the way, which turns out to have many uses, one of which is helping them find the food and another is finding their way home again.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing inadvertently pees on his blankie. Fortunately, his toy has a cape just as soft.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco shows Bing how to do really good Big Boos and together they make Flop jump. When Bing tries out his new tricks on Charlie he finds out the power of Boo has to be scaled down for babies.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula discover a new toy at Amma’s crèche, a talking ride on car. It seems like fun until Talkie Taxi keeps saying the same thing over and over again. When the taxi crashes and is finally silenced Bing and Sula use their imagination to play a game they really want to play without being dictated to by the noisy taxi.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its a windy day, and Bing wants to fly his Hoppity Voosh kite with Flop.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s bath time and Bing just can’t help adding a few more quirts of bubble goo…and a few more….and a few more, until he gets more bubbles than he can handle.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Caillou’s Holiday Movie
programme.desc: When winter comes to Caillous house, this curious 4-year-old tackles all kinds of big boy activities like helping Daddy shovel snow, making holiday presents for his family and even discovering how other little boys and girls around the world celebrate the season!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: While Kate and Mom are looking after a box of kittens, the box tips and they run all over the house. In Mimiloo, a flurry of mitty kats have overtaken Lily and Boomer’s house! Kate cleverly spots something they can use to round up the mitty kats and lead them home to the Winter Waterfalls.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Today, T’choupi and his friends, Nina and Luce, must help Fred take his goats to a field a certain distance away. But when Loupiote the dog gets wounded and is unable to shepherd the goats, the kids are very disappointed. Until, all of a sudden, they get a brilliant idea: why don’t they stand in for Loupiote and play shepherd dog, to guide the goat herd to the grazing field?...!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi and Nina find out there’s going to be a star shower visible in the sky tonight, they get very excited, and determined not to miss it! But they’re going to have to persuade their parents in order for that to happen… Not an easy feat: they’re way too young to stay up so late…

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Grandma offers Sam and Julia a curious calendar representing the Mouse Mansion, each numbered window revealing an apartment the way it was long ago when its inhabitant first arrived.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: The triplets are hard to put to sleep. Just as hard as Sams dad was! says Grandma. The only thing that used to put him to sleep was an old mobile, but its completely out of order...

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Spring has arrived and Tilda fervently wants to paint a white sheep on a green meadow. She grabs her easel and sets off. Her friends may have lots of other suggestions for things she could paint, but she has her heart set on a sheep. Her friend Patrick the sheep turns out to be a difficult model: he just cant keep still.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The wind is blowing on the beach while the Triplets are really excited at the thought of trying their brand new kite. But because of the wind ziouuuff the three sun hats fly away and go into the sea. The children don’t know what to do and look for a way to get their hats back. But by the way, where are going all the items which fly away?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The boys and Kiko are making a football field to play on the beach, all they need is a fourth player to make two teams. They ask Girl who was picking up shells on the beach. She happily accepts their offer but once the field’s ready, and with no explication at all, Girl starts sulking on her towel and refuse to talk to the boys. Nothing will make her stop, not pulling faces, not Mommies’ hugs, not even candies! What could have possibly happen?

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Berry sees a shooting star in the sky and makes a wish to become a princess, Princess Berry. To spare her from being disappointed, Rosie, Scoutbadger and Woodsy pretend that she has indeed really become a princess. But Princess Berry turns out to be a very demanding princess…

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his friends organize their own sports day and even try the high jump!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou tells his class about the exciting BBQ he had on the weekend!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When the Fat Controller gives Daisy the job of conveying some special passengers up to the holiday town of Harwick, she gets carried away with the responsibility – deciding that, because she is a very special engine, they must be very special passengers! Not stopping for a group of children with sticky ice lollies and refusing to pull a dusty baggage truck results in the passengers not being able to perform their puppet show! Once the audience has been specially bussed in for the show, Daisy is humbled as she becomes a puppet stand for the performance of… a Punch And Judy puppet show!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: It’s time for the three trainees to move up to advanced training. Wilson joins the Chug Patrol rescue squad, Brewster teams up with the Chuggineer construction crew and Speed Fleet recruits super-fast Koko. When Koko finds herself in peril, Wilson rushes to her rescue and pulls her out of a collapsing mine tunnel, proving that he is a brave new hero of the rails.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: When Emery breaks down in the forest, it’s Chug Patroller Wilson to the rescue. Wilson uses his new skills to locate Emery with the aid of a flare and gets him back on track with a huge crane.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: The children can hardly contain their excitement because today is the first day of school! Charley, Paulie and Lily have only one thing on their mind: meeting their new teacher! They especially want to know whether she will be nice. But oh, what a disappointment when they find out their teacher is… the school principal and he is very strict. Or isn’t he….?

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave report all the big stories in the Jungle for the ‘Daily Banana’ newspaper. Hatty helps them ask all the right questions, so their reports include everything their readers need to know about Larry the Leopard’s amazing rescue, a Parrot’s first ever ‘loop-the-loop’ and Bobby the Monkey’s record-breaking weight lifting victory!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: With just a few strokes of his pencil, Doodleboo always manages to do a funny drawing that comes to life as soon as it has been coloured.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo, Katie, Hero and a sun bear cub set off for the rainforest to find the cub’s mother. Alas, they end up trapped in an overgrowth of stinky Rafflesia flowers! Can the Junior Rangers, Hero and sun bear cub overcome the overpowering odour of the Rafflesias and escape?

programme.desc: Berry and Dolly gets a present but they start a fight to posess it. Finally turns out that they got a tandem bicycle.

programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing finds his old baby shoes that are much too small for him now. When the shoes fit baby Charlie perectly, Bing has a hard time letting them go.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Flop is feeling poorly so Bing decides to look after him. When Bing tries to make Flop a honey-lemon drink he ends up making a big mess instead.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Pando and me did music all together.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are playing a vooshing game with their favourite toys, Hoppity Voosh and Hippo Fairy. They throw them into the air to see how high they can fly – Voooooosh! Uh-oh…Sula’s hippo gets stuck in a tree so Bing throws Hoppity up to save her, only for Hoppity to get stuck too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are playing outside in the cold, blowing steamy dragon breath at each other and discovering icicles hanging from the tap. Flop makes hot chocolate to warm everybody up but Bing can’t wait for it to cool down before he can drink it and burns his fingers – Pando’s quick thinking brings the icicle to the rescue.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Plum’s plan to direct a small, simple fairytale play as a surprise performance for the Baby Berrykins snowballs out of control when she hears of the same play being done on a grand scale in Berry Big City. Not listening to Strawberry’s advice to keep it simple, she becomes convinced that unless her production is as big, she’ll be the laughing stock of the berry bitty theatrical world! Casting the girls and Berrykins as stage stars in a sendup of “Snow White and the Seven Dwarves,” Plum attempts to match the spectacular stage effects of a big city theater.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Scoutbadger, Woodsy and Rosie are about to celebrate the winter solstice according to the fox tradition: they spend the longest night of the year awake, and the whole family has fun. The foxes’ tradition is wholly different from that of the badgers, who celebrate the winter solstice by going to bed very early, to make the most of the longest sleep of the year. Yet, Edmunddecides that badgers and foxes are each going to follow their own tradition, separately.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It is a sunny Spring day in the meadow and Little Nutbrown Hare is enjoying all it has to offer. As the day wears on a heavy grey cloud forces Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse to seek shelter from the rain. Will the friends let a little water ruin their fun or will they discover that rainy days can be just as exciting.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is disappointed when a trail of ants disappears with the delicious Spring berries he’s found. He’s convinced that ants are not very nice, and only after Big Nutbrown Hare explains how the ants were probably taking the berries home to their families does Little Nutbrown Hare forgive them. And when he sees how clever the ants are, he soon wants to be like them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, and their friends are picking apples when an old steam locomotive appears on the hill. At the request of the scarlet beetle train engineer, the little friends help repair the locomotive and paint the wagons in bright colors. The cinnabar beetle thanks them by taking them on a special train trip to the great waterfall. The friends enjoy the journey and have a fun day together. At the end of the trip, they happily return home with the colorful train.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam has a very bad night. He only finds sleep when he lies down on the floor in the morning. Julia finds him there and tries to understand how to get Sam back to sleeping well, in his own bed.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets remember their first days with Toto very well. They had had to teach him well, just as Mom said, but it was easier said than done, for the little dog had decided to mark his territory and refused to give his paw. At night, the kids heard him cry in his basket and wanted to reassure him, but off to bed had said Mom. However she was not as harsh as it seems because in the morning, guess who the Triplets found warmly tucked in their Mom’s bed?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: While strolling through the city gardens, the triplets are delighted to stumble upon a gelato street vendor. They would love to have one but « not before lunch », says Mom. The three kids try to negotiate but in vain. As she gets lost in a daydream in which she is the queen of a world made of ice cream and whipped cream, Girl does not notice that her mom and her brothers are gone. She decides to go back to the ice-cream stand. Will she be able to resist to help herself to a delicious ice cream? Of course not!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Koko, Wilson and Brewster give Piper a surprise tour.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When the banks of the Pontypandy River burst, Mandy and Norman go on an adventure to rescue their wildlife journal and sandwiches?

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Set in and around the village of Pontypandy in Wales, the series recounts the daily adventures of Fireman Sam as he comes to the rescue of his friends and colleagues in various perilous situations.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate’s new leggings are too big for her. She wishes she didn’t have to wait to grow bigger. In Mimiloo, Boomer also wishes he was bigger—so he could be faster in Tack’s obstacle course! When he gets ahold of Tack’s Sizerchanger invention, he becomes huge! It’s up to Kate to convince Boomer that he’s better off being Boomer-sized.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate wants to make friends with the man in the moon. In Mimiloo, Kate and Mim-Mim accidentally blast off in Tack’s new rocket ship! When they land, they meet Rumbly, a little guy made of rocks—who must be the man in the moon! Kate and Mim-Mim must help him repair his house and find their way back to Mimiloo.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: After Daddy accidentally frightens Caillou with a picture book monster named Squibby, he’s too scared to fall asleep. So, with a flashlight in hand, Caillou pretends to be a monster tracker where he “shines a light” on what scares him and discovers that it’s not so scary after all.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: While trying a new trick on his bike, Caillou loses control and has a fall, triggering a new fear of bike riding. But by playing with the Red Racer, the world’s best driver, Caillou learns how to manage his fear and try again.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Percy becomes paranoid about the snow, his nerves get the better of him, causing confusion on the rails.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Can the Junior Rangers help Kai find his sisters pet rabbit, Patches, who got lost on Rabbit Island?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: What was supposed to be a relaxing trip to the hot spring turns into a disaster when the mischievous Japanese Macaques steal the Junior Rangers gadgets.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat has to deliver a bouncy castle to Laurens class.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat is delivering a telescope to Charlie, but his satnav leads him in the wrong direction.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends put on a show in the park. After Coco’s dance, Pando’s song and Sula’s acrobatics display everyone is excited to see Bing’s finale. When he gets up on the stage Bing is overcome with stage fright so his friends, and rainbow fairy mice, come to the rescue.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Amma watch the fireworks at Bings house. Sula doesnt like the loud bangs, so she wears ear mufflers. Bing, on the other hand, thinks he is brave enough to watch the fireworks from the garden. All of a sudden, a very loud bang sends Bing running into the house and hiding under the kitchen table. Flop makes special ear gloves for Bing to enjoy the fireworks show without having to hear the loud bangs.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing helps Flop do the shopping at Padgets shop but whilst Flop is paying he finds a strawberry lolly that he cant resist putting in his pocket.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is on the swing in the park when Pando arrives and wants to have a go too. They agree to let each other have turns by counting up to ten, but Pando wont count properly.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is Its a Bing thing! which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Pongo, a loveable Chinese dragon, becomes Oswalds best friend after Oswald helps him out of a tough spot. But Pongo is so big and clumsy he creates havoc. Pongo decides he just doesnt belong, but Oswald shows him that clumsy or not, Pongo fits in wherever he is.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and Weenie are preparing to race in the Big City Go-Kart Race. But Oswald is so busy helping his friends get ready, he misses the start. He trails, but catches up quickly as everyone else’s go-karts fall apart. Oswald gives them all a lift and they cross the finish line together to share first prize - a trophy full of ice cream.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Sports guru Skye Sampson asks Bob to build a 100 metre zip-line for her new fitness program. Its a job that Leo should love to help with, but he seems very distracted. Leo is put in charge of finishing the launch platform and fixing the zip-line, but he keeps making mistakes and wonders if he is up to the job. Lofty tries to convince Leo of how well theyre doing, but when the zip-line comes loose its the last straw. Leo says he should give up being a builder. Scoop and Lofty panic that Leo is going to leave the team – they decide they must make things right! But in their attempts to fix the platform they end up demolishing it instead.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Science and engineering hot shot Mei Moon has designed and built a rocket, named Stella. If successful Stella will become the smallest rocket ever to reach space. The Spring City Rockets have gathered and made a banner to celebrate and Bobs job is to finish building Stellas launch pad near the Observatory. Lofty is given the important task of lifting Stella onto the launch pad. Mei reminds him he has to be very careful, but he becomes flustered and tries to place the rocket before the launch pad is finished. Stella falls off and flops into wet concrete, ejecting her landing parachute, which Lofty accidentally runs over and rips. Now the launch is ruined. The team clean the concrete splattered rocket by using the machine wash back at the yard, but they still have the problem of the ripped parachute.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare wakes up to a colourful sprig of holly in the snow outside the hollow log. It’s surprise gift from Little Spotty Deer, who has returned to the meadow. This gives Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse the idea to spread the joy and surprise all their other friends with a holly sprig too, so the three of them make a game of it. Theme: Spreading fun and joy.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Day It is the shortest day of the year so the sun doesnt rise until very late and is going to set very early. To Little Nutbrown Hare everything feels mixed up and theres no time to do all the things he wants to do. That’s until he and Little Field Mouse name it Topsy-Flopsy Day and decide to make a fun and funny day of it!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: In Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends try to find an extra special place and extra special food for Feast Day celebrations. When things go awry and nothing seems special at all, they discover that the most important thing is to be able to celebrate with those you love. Theme: celebrating with those you love.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy and his friends are making paper planes but Timmy needs some help from Finlay. Help Timmy decide which transport comes next.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Huckle and the gang hear strange mumbling voices in the Busytown Museum, it begins to look like it’s coming from the new Mummy Exhibit. However, after tracking down the clues and putting them together, the sounds turn out to be the voices of the workmen echoing up through air vents from the basement.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world Messy is playing with his toy planes, cars and boats and wonders how they all work, so he goes to Okido to find out! When he arrives, Felix and Zoe, they tell him to hurry because they want to watch the “All Okido Race to Windy Hill” with him. “There’s a mystery prize!” they tell him. Messy says they won’t watch the race… because they’re going to be in the race and win! He whistles over the Okidoodle and they skidoodle to the starting line!

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world Messy can’t reach a sock in the top drawer! He wonders if he’ll ever be tall enough.“When you need to know, go to Okido!” he says. Messy gets to Okido just in time to catch Felix and Zoe leaving to meet Zim, Zam and Zoom at the funfair! They jump into the Okidoodle, but Felix accidentally lets go of the funfair map, which flies away! Messy stops and luckily, Lofty the giant was there to catch it for them. Lofty is with his niece Mini, and so they invite her to the funfair with them. “Mini’s a bit too big for the Okidoodle” notices Messy, so she follows behind on her scooter.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: When Huckleberry and Blueberry’s Patti Persimmon-style mystery story is rejected by the online mystery magazine, Strawberry comes up with a new way to raise funds for Huck’s pet shelter—a big dog show! Plum attempts to turn the dog show into an extravagant dance performance. The competition heats up, everyone wanting their pup to perform in an even more spectacular manner, and the dog training sessions go comically awry. Meanwhile Huck and Blueberry co-write a monster mystery, inadvertently starting a rumor that a Berry Patch monster is loose! The rumor, combined with Jadeybug from the post office forgetting to send out the show invitations, results in no one coming to the show. Fortunately, Blueberry had submitted her and Huck’s new mystery story to the online magazine, and the editor is thrilled with their work.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is pleased when he wins a game he is playing with Nana so he visits Dino-World where he makes up lots of games and wins every time.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry wants to do lots of things all at once so instead of choosing one activity he goes to Dino-World.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Peyo and Pico play hide and seek in a forest clearing in the Paraguana Peninsula, but their game takes an unexpected turn when Pico gets tangled in spider web, triggering an angry tarantula. Leo, Katie, and Hero enjoy dancing in the garden until they receive a distress call from Peyo, who tells them about the tarantula. They learn about the tarantulas habitat and behavior before Peyo gets bitten by the spider during the call. Leo, Katie and Hero fly to Peyo and Katie treats Peyo’s spider bite but suddenly, the tarantula and Pico go missing! After searching the area, they find the tarantula… upside down, to their worries. Ranger Rocky shows up and they reach out to Ranger Joey for further information and learn that the spider is in the process of molting and with no web to protect it. Hero chases Pico and accidentally bumps into Katie who drops the bandage she used earlier and this gives Leo an idea. They all wait in the bush while a snake approaches the bush with the spider in it but turns away as it is met with a makeshift spider web made from the bandage. The spider can now molt safely and Ranger Rocky mentions he will come back to clean up the bandage once it is done molting. Mission accomplished, and back at the treehouse, Katie surprises Leo by mastering the dance steps they practiced earlier but is bumped by Hero.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas helps Ruth fix up an old windmill into her new, energy-efficient workshop.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When the Rickety Old Bridge collapses, trapping Toby and Henrietta on the other side of the ravine, Inventor Ruth is asked to build a new one.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: At the request of Emma the forest ranger, Grisu has to tag the sick trees in the forest. The trees must absolutely be cut down before the storm arrives. But all the marks he makes are erased by a mysterious eraser: Fume, who is determined to defend his tree. Grisu finds a solution by using his father to replant the tree sheltered from the wind.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Olivia competes in the famous Sand Dune Race in a new electric 4x4 she has designed, but her co-pilot has just pulled out. Fortunately, Grisu will take his place. Accompanied by Fume and Stella, he joins Olivia in the desert. The race begins and soon Slad and Vlad - better known as “The Tricktwins” - give them a hard time. The twins, ready to do anything to win, try to trick them. While Grisu and Olivias charred windsceen prevents them from moving forward, Grisu has an idea that allows them to get back in the race. Before crossing the finish line, they even help the Tricktwins to get out of a quicksand.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse befriend a little green caterpillar but arent prepared for the changes it will undergo.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse see a beautiful rainbow. When it disappears before Big Nutbrown Hare can see it, they recreate it for him with flowers.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn a passenger service badge, Wilson must speak up, be nice to his passengers, and smile at all times – no matter what happens! His passengers know that it’s a test, and go out of their way to make things very challenging for Wilson - but he keeps smiling and earns his badge.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Grandpa and Grandma have come to look after the children. In the afternoon, Grandma goes for a walk in the forest with Scoutbadger, Rosie and Berry. Grandpa stays in the burrow with Woodsy who thinks he is going to have a quiet time but things turn out to be more hectic than he had anticipated.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Team Bob are creating a Soft Play Cafe for Chef Tattie in an old warehouse by the docks, ready for an opening party tomorrow. Though the build is on track, Chef can’t decide what colour to paint the disco room so Bob offers to put up paint samples for him to choose from. Leo shows off his ‘mash-up’ app and Tattie decides that Leo should DJ for the party. However, Leo isn’t as confident as he appeared to Chef and the extra responsibility distracts him from the build. Eventually he ends up walking through spilled paint after putting up the colour samples, leaving differently coloured footprints all over the floor.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Leo is late as he’s overslept thanks to staying up late playing a fishing game on his phone. Bob, Lofty, Leo and Wendy are installing a satellite dish and at the Spring City News HQ located at the docks. The dish has to be in place in time for the Six O’Clock News bulletin. En route to site the team stop to say hello to the Spring City Rockets who are practicing in preparation for a dance show later that day which will be covered on the news. On site Leo and Lofty are teamed up. During the build Leo is distracted by the game; Lofty suggests he should pay more attention. While tying the dish to Lofty’s hook Leo - distracted by the game - does not secure it properly. As Lofty raises the dish it comes loose and drops to the floor.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Baby Sadies dolly has mysteriously gone missing somewhere between home and the band shell in Busytown Park. Huckle and his team search for clues at all the places Sadie visited that day. They discover the dolly inside a grand piano thats playing a few sour notes./Cars are disappearing from a particular parking space, Huckle and gang set out to find out why.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A swim in the garden brings Leo and Hero up close and personal with a Malayan water monitor. The Junior Rangers set out to search for the monitor’s home, but will their jeep survive a river crossing after a jeep float gets punctured?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Imagine Leo’s surprise when he realises that a piece of seaweed in his aquarium is actually a leafy seadragon! The Junior Rangers set forth to put the leafy seadragon back in Australian waters, but their mission changes course when they have to save leafy seadragons that have been washed ashore.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: When Simon, Lou and Ferdinand hear a strange noise near their cabin while playing, they run away and vow not to go into the cabin again. This sounds like a job for superheroes!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Leapy, the grasshopper girl, gets paint on her hair while painting her house in the spring. She can’t wash it off, so Zephyr, the dragonfly, offers to cut her hair. Leapy is very sad when she sees herself in the mirror; she doesn’t like her new hairstyle. At Zephyrs suggestion, they show the others, but only Dolly notices the change and compliments her. Later, they hold a hairstyle day, where everyone creates special hairstyles for themselves. Leapy happily finishes painting her house and invites her friends to a spring feast.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Stanleys birthday is approaching, and he becomes very curious and can’t wait to find out what gift he will receive from Dolly. He peeks into the ladybird girls drawer. The next day, he tells Balthazar that he knows what his gift will be. On his birthday, the friends gather and wish Stanley a happy birthday. Flutter presents the cake, they sing, and then Stanley blows out the candles and cuts the cake. Stanley receives many nice gifts, including a bowling set from Dolly. Stanley admits that he peeked into the ladybird girls drawer because he was curious about his gift.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Shaun invites his friends to Sand Island during the summer heatwave. Christopher and Chloe, the two canaries, ferry the friends over. Bubble, Balthazar, Dolly, Stanley, Berry, Flutter, and Shaun build sand houses. Balthazar accidentally knocks down Bubble the flower beetles house. Suddenly, a summer shower begins and washes away all the sand houses. They stand sadly around their ruined creations and decide to build a large drip sandcastle together. Side by side, they build drip towers, construct castle walls, and decorate the tops with sand balls. The day passes joyfully, and by the evening, when the canaries come to pick them up, magnificent drip towers stand tall on the island.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: At the end of summer, the Star Girl visits her friends. She rarely comes because her star-shaped house is in the sky. They spend a day together, and when night falls, the Star Girl bids everyone farewell. She can’t speak, but she plays the harp beautifully. The music will lift her house into the sky. However, this time one of the harp strings comes loose, and the house doesn’t rise. The Wind blows the string out of her hand, and she can’t catch it.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The Centipedes apple tree hasn’t had any fruit for many years. He asks Berry for help, who carefully tends to the tree. At the beginning of summer, apples finally appear, and the Centipede is so happy that he invites his distant relative, the Millipede, for a visit. However, the Millipede falls ill and can’t come. The Centipede then invites his friends to a big apple party. When they arrive, they pretend that the Millipede was there, but it turns out that it was just his friends in costume.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The Cave Spider and the tiny Spiderling are good friends, and one summer day they are walking on the mountaintop. Spiderling blows a dandelion at the Cave Spider, who falls and gets injured. Spiderling immediately seeks help from Doctor Owl, who determines that the Cave Spiders legs are bruised and prescribes two weeks of rest. Berry, Dolly, Stanley, and Balthazar help the Cave Spider get home. Dolly suggests they sew a large canopy so the Cave Spider can watch the ants end-of-summer fireworks from the air. Flutter, Leapy, Zephyr, and the others make the canopy, and on the night of the fireworks, they lift the Cave Spider up so he can enjoy the view from above.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a spring day, Alfonso finds an unknown seedling by the stream. The cricket carefully guards the plant, which soon produces a special flower. Alfonso waters and tends to it daily, happily watching it grow. One morning at the end of summer, Alfonso notices that the flower has wilted and its petals have fallen off. Sadly, he gathers the petals and brings them into the house. In the afternoon, Dolly visits him, and later his friends come over to cheer him up. They bring delicious pancakes, but Alfonso is still sad. They go out to the stream, and Alfonso scatters the flower petals into the water, bidding them farewell with tears.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is disappointed he cant go play because hes all sneezy but Sula and Amma bring him a nice carroty bagel to help him get better.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is playing Hide And Seek at the crèche with Sula, Pando and Coco. Bing doesn’t go to the toilet with all the others before the game starts and when he needs to go before he is found he has to decide whether to give up his hiding place or try and hold on.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are making ginger bunny biscuits for Charlie and Coco.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is Its a Bing thing! which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: It’s National Hugging Day! All the friends hug each other, except for Rupert. Tilda knows there’s something wrong! Rupert is afraid his spines could hurt anyone. But Tilda already has an idea.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Molly is excited for her friend Mings visit and to show her favourite spot. However, Ming keeps getting distracted. Molly eventually goes alone, but Ming finds her, and the picnic can finally begin.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert builds a tree from wood instead of cutting one down. Soon, everyone wants one too, and the friends are so busy they forget the Advent celebration. The children decorate and save the day.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Crisp Autumn days are perfect for collecting pretty golden leaves and playing hide and boo. Little Nutbrown Hare is so excited that he accidently promises to play with two different games with two different friends on the same day. He can’t be in two places at once, so how will he keep both his promises and both his friends happy?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: A fun, spooky tale from little White Owl leaves the friends a little on edge, so when they hear strange noises in the pumpkin patch, they wonder what kind of creepy creature might be lurking there with them. Will Big Nutbrown Hare be able to convince them not to let their imaginations run away with them?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The friends are all playing together in the Autumn meadow. Little Redwood Fox inadvertently spoils all the games of the day, but the others put their heads together and come up with a game that suits her perfectly.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Gaspard both have nightmares because of the dragon story Grandma read them just before going to bed. Grandma tries to calm them down by giving them a glass of water but once back in bed, Gaspard can only think of the dragon. Simon joins him in his bed but then there is a noise under their bunk beds and they run off to Grandpa and Grandma’s bedroom, believing there is a dragon in the room. But Grandpa is quick to discover the real identity of the dragon: it’s Elvis, their dog!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo finds a blue pansy caterpillar, and the Junior Rangers set off to find a home for it. On the way, they come upon other blue pansy caterpillars and butterflies, whose home will be destroyed soon. Can the Junior Rangers find a new home for all these blue pansies?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Koko is put in charge of Wilson and Brewster. The team has to complete a newspaper round by a certain time. Koko nearly fails and learns that being bossy isn’t the best way to lead. She tries again, using her team members’ strengths instead and in the end shares her badge with Wilson and Brewster. After all – they’re a team!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: The trainees have to assess each other as they do braking tests in the park. Wilson doesn’t do so well – and the trainees consider reporting that he did better than he actually did. In the end, Wilson decides they should be honest to Vee, even if it means forfeiting his badge – but Vee tells them the badge wasn’t for braking, but for good judgment, which they’ve shown by telling the truth!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is sad when he learns that Plume the rabbit has hurt her paw. He and Nina decide to take their little furry friend into T’choupi’s bedroom: she’ll be safe in there and able to get a good rest while they take good care of her. T’choupi’s certain this is a good solution. But little does he know… cheeky little Plume has other ideas…!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: It’s Father’s Day today. But neither T’choupi nor Nina can come up with a good idea for a special present for their respective dads. Benedicte suggests they gather up various objects from the forest and make drawings with them, on the ground. Great idea… except land art turns out to be a bit more complicated than they expected. And, more importantly, are their dads even going to like it?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Tchoupi and Nina come across a waddling hedgehog while they’re playing in the vegetable garden. programme.title: Sam And Julia

programme.title: Sam And Julia

programme.title: Thomas and Friends

programme.title: Thomas and Friends

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)

programme.title: Thomas And Friends

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Zari was backpacking through the forest where she discovers a bunch of discarded leaves and branches on the floor due to the aftermath of the storm. As she investigate further, the wind blows a paper cup near her. Zari was perplexed as she mistaken the insect with an actual leaf, causing her to call in the Rangers. Back at the headquarters, Leo is searching for Hero and Katie as theyre playing hide And seek. As Leo is struggling to find Katie, he receives a call from Zari, who asks for help with the strange animal. Leo and Katie travels with PlatypusOne to reach Zari. As they arrived, Zari tells them to be careful because the leaves on the ground could be a Malayan Leaf insect too. After carefully going investigate and not finding any, the wind manage to blow the Malayan Leaf insect out of Katies hand. Leo chases it down with his jetpack, manage to safe the animal from harm. The gang then tries to find a proper place for the insect. They then stumble a new location, where a mouse-deer is nearby. Leo put the insect on a high branch, when suddenly they got greeted by Ranger Rocky. He then calls for Ranger Joey for more information on the Malayan Leaf Insect, where she fully explains its habitat and predators that may appear. She advices them that the mouse-deer might mistake the insect as an actual leaf and would eat it, where Leo take the advice and put the insect somewhere higher on the trees. The Rangers went home where Leo put the Malayan Leaf insect photo on the wall. He then figured to look for Katie and hero to continue their game earlier, but Katie and Hero was already inside the treehouse, indifferent to Leos game. Ranger Rocky finally thanks them for a great job on the computer screen.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: As Farah is drawing poop on her handbook in the national park, she hears a loud growl nearby and leaps onto her dirtbike to seek the source. She sees a lioness and her cub stuck inside a man-made well, clumsily failing to get out. She immediately calls the Rangers for help. Back in the garden, Leo And Katie were playing frisbee. Katie tries to do throw it just like Leo does it but she fails, upsetting her. As Leo instructs Katie on how to do it, he receives the call from Farah. Farah tells them about the trapped animals, causing the duo to learn more about the lion back in the treehouse. Farah then informs them of more lions coming over, where Leo tells her to get to safety first. As the Rangers arrive and land PlatypusOne from afar, Leo uses his binoculars and sees the 2 female lions still roaming around the well. They see Farah hides on top of a nearby hill and meet her there. As they were discussing on how to help the lioness, Katie points out a fallen log nearby that can be used. Farah misunderstood and rush onto her bike to cause a distraction for the 2 lioness around the well, but Ranger Rocky appears and stops her. Ranger Rocky then ask more information on the Asiatic Lion from Ranger Joey. Ranger Joey advices them about the Asiatic Lions hunting behavior, giving the group an idea to pretend as a Sambar Deer to distract the animal there.
